meanings.definition: To assert or lay down dogmatically
meanings.sent1: She would often dogmatize her views on politics during family dinners.
meanings.sent2: He tends to dogmatize his preferences when it comes to music.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to dogmatize the rules of the house, but no one took her seriously.
meanings.sent4: His boss would dogmatize the company policies as if they were unchangeable laws.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's way of dogmatizing the correct answer made the students feel intimidated.

meanings.definition: To express opinions or beliefs in a dogmatic way
meanings.sent1: The politician would often dogmatize his stance on controversial issues.
meanings.sent2: She tends to dogmatize her ideas without considering other perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The comedian humorously dogmatized about the best way to eat a sandwich.
meanings.sent4: His speech dogmatized the importance of kindness in a world full of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The author's writing style dogmatized the value of friendship in every story.
